Hi,

 seems that everybody has it's own way of doing things. What we do is simply
put the test classes with the code, in the same package & the same project.
We use different project & packages for special test classes (AllTests,
etc..).

I didn't found any real problem with having the test go with the production
code. Actually I like it. You can never lose track of the tests, and you can
run them in (pre-)production if you want, just to ensure that production env
(soft&hardware) behaves like dev.

Because we have a naming convention where every test class name begins with
"Test", it's also pretty easy to manipulate them when exporting.
Why hide the tests? I'm proud of them! :) And I want them to be seen right
aside the class they test, so it gives a visual clue that they need to
follow the evolution of the class. Anyway.... :)

mathieu
